properties.Description: Nrt alert rule base property bag.

kind.Description: The kind of the alert rule

alertRuleTemplateName.Description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

templateVersion.Description: The version of the alert rule template used to create this rule - in format <a.b.c>, where all are numbers, for example 0 <1.0.2>

description.Description: The description of the alert rule.

query.Description: The query that creates alerts for this rule.

displayName.Description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

enabled.Description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

lastModifiedUtc.Description: The last time that this alert rule has been modified.

suppressionDuration.Description: The suppression (in ISO 8601 duration format) to wait since last time this alert rule been triggered.

suppressionEnabled.Description: Determines whether the suppression for this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

tactics.Description: The tactics of the alert rule

customDetails.Description: Dictionary of string key-value pairs of columns to be attached to the alert

entityMappings.Description: List of entity mappings of the alert rule

alertDetailsOverride.Description: Settings for how to dynamically override alert static details

createIncident.Description: Create incidents from alerts triggered by this analytics rule

lookbackDuration.Description: Limit the group to alerts created within the lookback duration (in ISO 8601 duration format)

matchingMethod.Description: Grouping matching method. When method is Selected at least one of groupByEntities, groupByAlertDetails, groupByCustomDetails must be provided and not empty.

groupByEntities.Description: A list of entity types to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected). Only entities defined in the current alert rule may be used.

groupByAlertDetails.Description: A list of alert details to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected)

groupByCustomDetails.Description: A list of custom details keys to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected). Only keys defined in the current alert rule may be used.

entityType.Description: The V3 type of the mapped entity

fieldMappings.Description: array of field mappings for the given entity mapping

identifier.Description: the V3 identifier of the entity

columnName.Description: the column name to be mapped to the identifier

alertDisplayNameFormat.Description: the format containing columns name(s) to override the alert name

alertDescriptionFormat.Description: the format containing columns name(s) to override the alert description

alertTacticsColumnName.Description: the column name to take the alert tactics from

alertSeverityColumnName.Description: the column name to take the alert severity from

Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

contentId.Description: Static ID for the content.  Used to identify dependencies and content from solutions or community.  Hard-coded/static for out of the box content and solutions. Can be optionally set for user created content to define dependencies.  If an active content item is made from a template, both will have the same contentId.

parentId.Description: Full parent resource ID of the content item the metadata is for.  This is the full resource ID including the scope (subscription and resource group)

version.Description: Version of the content.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM template best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks

kind.Description: The kind of content the metadata is for.

source.Description: The original source of the content item, where it comes from.

author.Description: Publisher or creator of the content item.

support.Description: Support information for the content item.

dependencies.Description: Dependencies for the content item, what other content items it requires to work.  Can describe more complex dependencies using a recursive/nested structure. For a single dependency an id/kind/version can be supplied or operator/criteria for complex dependencies.

categories.Description: ies for the solution content item

providers.Description: Providers for the solution content item

firstPublishDate.Description: first publish date of solution content item

lastPublishDate.Description: last publish date of solution content item

name.Description: Name of the content source.  The repo name, solution name, LA workspace name etc.

sourceId.Description: ID of the content source.  The solution ID, workspace ID, etc

name.Description: Name of the author. Company or person.

tier.Description: Type of support for content item

name.Description: Name of the support contact. Company or person.

link.Description: Link for support help, like to support page to open a ticket etc.

contentId.Description: Static ID for the content.  Used to identify dependencies and content from solutions or community.  Hard-coded/static for out of the box content and solutions. Can be optionally set for user created content to define dependencies.  If an active content item is made from a template, both will have the same contentId.

kind.Description: The kind of content the metadata is for.

version.Description: Version of the content.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM template best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks

operator.Description: Operator used for list of dependencies in criteria array.

criteria.Description: This is the list of dependencies we must fulfill, according to the AND/OR operator

domains.Description: domain for the solution content item

verticals.Description: Industry verticals for the solution content item

displayName.Description: The display name of the source control

description.Description: A description of the source control

contentTypes.Description: Array of source control content types.

pathMapping.Description: Dictionary of source control content type and path mapping.

contentType.Description: The content type of a source control path.

watchlistId.Description: The id (a Guid) of the watchlist

displayName.Description: The display name of the watchlist

created.Description: The time the watchlist was created

updated.Description: The last time the watchlist was updated

createdBy.Description: User information that made some action

updatedBy.Description: User information that made some action

isDeleted.Description: A flag that indicates if the watchlist is deleted or not

labels.Description: List of labels relevant to this watchlist

defaultDuration.Description: The default duration of a watchlist (in ISO 8601 duration format)

tenantId.Description: The tenantId where the watchlist belongs to

numberOfLinesToSkip.Description: The number of lines in a csv/tsv content to skip before the header

rawContent.Description: The raw content that represents to watchlist items to create. In case of csv/tsv content type, it's the content of the file that will parsed by the endpoint

itemsSearchKey.Description: The search key is used to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining to other event data by IP address.

contentType.Description: The content type of the raw content. Example : text/csv or text/tsv

uploadStatus.Description: The status of the Watchlist upload : New, InProgress or Complete. Pls note : When a Watchlist upload status is equal to InProgress, the Watchlist cannot be deleted

watchlistItemsCount.Description: The number of Watchlist Items in the Watchlist

updated.Description: The last time the watchlist item was updated

properties.Description: Represents Codeless API Polling data connector

connectorUiConfig.Description: Config to describe the instructions blade

pollingConfig.Description: Config to describe the polling config for API poller connector

customImage.Description: An optional custom image to be used when displaying the connector within Azure Sentinel's connector's gallery

graphQueriesTableName.Description: Name of the table the connector will insert the data to

graphQueries.Description: The graph query to show the current data status

sampleQueries.Description: The sample queries for the connector

dataTypes.Description: Data types to check for last data received

connectivityCriteria.Description: Define the way the connector check connectivity

instructionSteps.Description: Instruction steps to enable the connector

metricName.Description: the metric that the query is checking

baseQuery.Description: The base query for the graph

name.Description: Name of the data type to show in the graph. can be use with {{graphQueriesTableName}} placeholder

lastDataReceivedQuery.Description: Query for indicate last data received

resourceProvider.Description: Resource provider permissions required for the connector

customs.Description: Customs permissions required for the connector

auth.Description: Describe the authentication properties needed to successfully authenticate with the server

request.Description: Describe the request properties needed to successfully pull from the server

paging.Description: Describe the properties needed to make a pagination call

response.Description: Describes the response from the external server

apiKeyName.Description: The header name which the token is sent with

apiKeyIdentifier.Description: A prefix send in the header before the actual token

isApiKeyInPostPayload.Description: Marks if the key should sent in header

flowName.Description: Describes the flow name, for example 'AuthCode' for Oauth 2.0

tokenEndpoint.Description: The endpoint used to issue a token, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

authorizationEndpoint.Description: The endpoint used to authorize the user, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

redirectionEndpoint.Description: The redirect endpoint where we will get the authorization code, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

isClientSecretInHeader.Description: Marks if we should send the client secret in header or payload, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

apiEndpoint.Description: Describe the endpoint we should pull the data from

queryWindowInMin.Description: The window interval we will use the pull the data

httpMethod.Description: The http method type we will use in the poll request, GET or POST

queryTimeFormat.Description: The time format will be used the query events in a specific window

retryCount.Description: Describe the amount of time we should try and poll the data in case of failure

timeoutInSeconds.Description: The number of seconds we will consider as a request timeout

queryParametersTemplate.Description: For advanced scenarios for example user name/password embedded in nested JSON payload

startTimeAttributeName.Description: This will be used the query events from a start of the time window

endTimeAttributeName.Description: This will be used the query events from the end of the time window

nextPageParaName.Description: Defines the name of a next page attribute

nextPageTokenJsonPath.Description: Defines the path to a next page token JSON

pageCountAttributePath.Description: Defines the path to a page count attribute

pageTotalCountAttributePath.Description: Defines the path to a page total count attribute

pageTimeStampAttributePath.Description: Defines the path to a paging time stamp attribute

searchTheLatestTimeStampFromEventsList.Description: Determines whether to search for the latest time stamp in the events list

pageSizeParaName.Description: Defines the name of the page size parameter

eventsJsonPaths.Description: Describes the path we should extract the data in the response

successStatusJsonPath.Description: Describes the path we should extract the status code in the response

successStatusValue.Description: Describes the path we should extract the status value in the response

isGzipCompressed.Description: Describes if the data in the response is Gzip
